Krems?" and so on. The Em- peror spoke as if his sole aim were to put a giv- en number of questions the answers to these questions, as was only too evident, did not in- terest him. 
"At what o'clock did the battle begin?" asked the Emperor. 
"I cannot inform Your Majesty at what o'clock the battle began at the front, but at Durrenstein, where I was, our attack began aft- er five in the afternoon," replied Bolk6nski growing more animated and expecting that he would have a chance to give a relia
